data_pins.docs:
**, list of [pins](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: A list of the data pins you have hooked up to the LCD. The list can either be 4 items long (operating in 4-bit mode with either the first 4 data pins connected or the last 4 data pins connected), or 8 items long (when you have connected all 8 data pins).

*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

enable_pin.docs:
**, [pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin you have `E` (`06`) hooked up to.

*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

rs_pin.docs:
**, [pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin you have `RS` (`04`) hooked up to.

*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

rw_pin.docs:
**, [pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Optionally set the pin you have `R/W` (`05`) hooked up to. You can also just permanently connect that pin to `GND`.

*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

update_interval.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `1s`.

*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*
